org.rakiura.cpn
Class ThreadedSimulator

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      org.rakiura.cpn.ThreadedSimulator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Simulator
public class ThreadedSimulator
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Simulator

A Petri net simulator and executor. This simulator can be used to simulate a net with the notion of time, or to execute a net for real time purposes. Check also TimedSimulator for simulated time petri nets.
The simulation / execution happens in its own thread. As long as only the methods provided in this class are used to manipulate the net, the execution AND manipulation of the Petri net are thread safe.
If this class is used for simulation, you are supposed not to start any new threads (to keep the notion of simulation time valid) and you can use the method addTimedToken to add tokens that are only enabled after a certain time.
In the case you use this class for execution, you are encouraged to create new threads to execute actions and to put tokens back into the net if the execution is done, with the method addTokens(java.util.Collection, java.lang.String).
The simulation/execution thread will run until there are no enabled transitions left. The thread will sleep until new tokens are added to the net.
A history of fired transitions is stored.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2003

Company: Dept. of Information Science, University of Otago, Dunedin

Version:

Field Detail

executeMonitor

public final java.lang.Object executeMonitor
this object is locked by the thread if the simulator is still running the simulation. Can be used to check if the simulation is still running.
synchronized(executeMonitor) { .. }

net

public Net net()
returns the net that is executed by this simulator. Warning: any attempt to change the net and its marking while the simulator is still running can raise exceptions and/or produce unexpected behaviour.

Specified by:

getTime

public long getTime()
Returns the current simulation time.

Returns:
the current simulation time.

run

public void run()
This method will execute the Petri net until stopSimulation is called or no transitions are left. During the running, a lock is on executeMonitor. If you need to stop this simulator, you can request a lock on the object as well, to be sure that the simulator has finished its last step.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Specified by:
run in interface Simulator
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread
See Also:
stopSimulation()

stopSimulation

public void stopSimulation()
Stops the execution of the simulator when the current step is finished.

pauseSimulation

public boolean pauseSimulation()
The simulation thread will pause before the next step is executed. You can resume the simulation with resumeSimulation().

Returns:
true if the simulation was not paused yet, false otherwise

resumeSimulation

public boolean resumeSimulation()
The simulation thread will resume with the next step after it was paused with resumeSimulation().

Returns:
true if the simulation was paused and is now resumed, false otherwise

getHistory

public java.util.ArrayList getHistory()
returns the handle to this simulators history. The first fired transition is at place 0, the rest is in chonological order starting from there.

Returns:
a copy of the history.

hasTokens

public boolean hasTokens()
Returns if there are still (timed) tokens to be added to the net.

Returns:
true if there are (timed) tokens not added yet, false otherwise.

                      java.lang.String place)
safe way of adding tokens

Parameters:
tokens - the token
place - the name of the place

addTimedToken

public void addTimedToken(java.lang.Object token,
                          java.lang.String place,
                          long relativeTime)
adds a token to the net that is activated only after a certain simulation time has passed.

Parameters:
token - the token to add
place - the place to add the token to
relativeTime - the time to disable the token. Any number < 0 will be interpreted as 0

step

public boolean step()
Runs a single step of the simulation.
All enabled transitions that can fire simultaneously will be picked, and fired.
The fired transitions' names will be added to the history.
This method returns true if there are still more enabled transitions, and false if there is no enabled transition left. If there are timed tokens, the simulation time will be increased to the next time where new tokens are enabled. Untimed tokens are all added, timed tokens of the current (or the new) time are added.

Specified by:
step in interface Simulator
Returns:
a boolean value, true if there are still more enabled transitions, and false if there is no enabled transition left.

addTokensNow

public void addTokensNow()
Adds added tokens to the net straight away if the simulation is not running. Use this method to display added tokens straight away when the simulation is not running, but executed step by step.
